required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Efficacy, Safety and Immunogenicity of GSK Biologicals' Herpes Zoster (HZ) Vaccine GSK1437173A in Adults Aged 50 Years and Older
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy, Safety, and Immunogenicity Study of GSK Biologicals' Herpes Zoster Vaccine GSK1437173A in Adults Aged 50 Years or Older

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this observer-blind study is to evaluate the efficacy, safety and immunogenicity of GSK Biologicals' candidate Herpes Zoster (HZ) vaccine in adults aged ≥ 50 years.
Two studies [ZOSTER-006 (NCT01165177) and ZOSTER-022 (NCT01165229)] are being conducted concurrently to evaluate efficacy of GSK1437173A vaccine. A pooled analysis of data from both studies combined will be conducted contingent on each study achieving its objectives. The protocol posting of study ZOSTER-022 also deals with the outcome measures related to the pooled analysis.

detailed_description.textblock:
This protocol summary has been updated following Protocol Amendment 4 changes to study objectives and endpoints and the analyses of the objectives in 2 steps.
Step 1 will include analyses of the following objectives of ZOSTER-006 (NCT01165177): all HZ VE objectives and all reactogenicity/safety and immunogenicity objectives. At step 2, all objectives of study ZOSTER-006 (NCT01165177) will be analyzed. Objectives already analyzed at step 1 will be re-analyzed (confirmatory descriptive in case of inferential analysis at step 1 or descriptive analysis otherwise). At step 2, pooled analyses of studies ZOSTER-006 (NCT01165177) and ZOSTER-022 (NCT01165229) are planned; overall PHN VE in subjects ≥ 70 YOA, and other pre-specified endpoints will be analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Confirmed Herpes Zoster (HZ) Cases
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
primary_outcome.description: Confirmed HZ cases during the study were assessed in the Modified Total Vaccinated Cohort (mTVc)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any Episodes of Post-Herpetic Neuralgia (PHN)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of PHN was calculated using the modified total vaccinated chort.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Reduction of Duration of Severe 'Worst' HZ-associated Pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Severe 'worst' pain was defined as HZ-associated pain rated as 3 or above on the 'worst pain' Zoster Brief Pain Inventory (ZBPI) questionnaire. The outcome assessed the duration of severe 'worst' HZ-associated pain following the onset of a confirmed HZ rash over the entire pain reporting period as measured by the ZBPI in subjects with confirmed HZ. This analysis involved any subject reporting clinically significant pain (i.e. pain with a score of 3 or more on a 0-10 point scale) at any time during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Confirmed HZ Episode Related Mortality
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis focused on the number of subjects who died due to HZ

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With HZ Related Complications
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis focused on the incidence of HZ complications in subjects with confirmed HZ

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Confirmed HZ Episode Related Hospitalizations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis focused on confirmed HZ episode related hospitalizations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Confirmed HZ Episode Having a Reduction of Duration of Pain Medication Associated With HZ
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis focused on patients who experienced a reduction in duration of pain medication administered for HZ in subjects with confirmed HZ.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Confirmed HZ Episode Taking Pain Medication Associated With HZ
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis focused on subjects taking pain medication due to HZ

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days With Severe 'Worst' HZ-associated Pain.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Severe 'worst' pain was defined as HZ-associated pain rated as 3 or above on the 'worst pain' ZBPI questionnaire. This Outcome Measure was only assessed participants with confirmed HZ. This analysis involved any subject reporting ZBPI clinically significant pain (i.e. pain with a score of 3 or more on a 0-10 point scale) at any time during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Confirmed HZ Episode Related Mortality and Hospitalizations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis focused on confirmed HZ episode related hospitalizations and deaths.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With HZ Related Complications, by Complication Type
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Complication types included HZ vasculitis, Disseminated Disease, Ophtalmic Disease, Neurologic Disease, Visceral Disease and Stroke. This Outcome Measure was only assessed participants with confirmed HZ.

secondary_outcome.measure: Distribution of Pain Medication Associated With HZ
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The distribution of pain medication included 1 to 3 or more separate medications. This Outcome Measure was only assessed participants with confirmed HZ.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days of Pain Medication Associated With HZ
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis was performed in subjects with a confirmed HZ episode

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 100 millimeters (mm) of injection site. Relationship analysis was not performed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, gastrointestinal symptoms, fever [defined as oral, axillary, rectal or tympanic temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)], headache, myalgia, shivering and sweating. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 symptom = symptom that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Symptoms (Solicited and Unsolicited)
Number of Subjects With Any and Related Potential Immune Mediated Diseases (pIMDs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence and relationship to vaccination of any potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs) in all subjects

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With AEs With Any and Related Medically Attended Visit (MAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence and relationship to vaccination of medically attended visits (defined as hospitalizations, emergency room visits or visits to or from medical personnel), other than routine health care visits in all subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence, intensity and relationship to vaccination of unsolicited AEs, according to the Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA) classification in all subjects An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination. Grade 3 AE = an AE which prevented normal, everyday activities. Related = AE assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the 30-day (Days 0-29) post-vaccination period, up to Month 14 and up to study end (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence and relationship to vaccination of all SAEs in all subjects. Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive Herpes Zoster Vaccine GSK1437173A according to a 0, 2-month schedule
Subjects will receive NaCl solution placebo according to a 0, 2-month schedule

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Out of all the subjects enrolled into this study, only 15405 received vaccination and were hence considered to start the study.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects received herpes zoster subunit vaccine (gE/AS01B vaccine: GSK1437173A) according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects received saline solution (NaCl solution) as control according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects received herpes zoster subunit vaccine (gE/AS01B vaccine: GSK1437173A) according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects received saline solution (NaCl solution) as control according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Age, Customized
Sex: Female, Male

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Confirmed Herpes Zoster (HZ) Cases
outcome.description: Confirmed HZ cases during the study were assessed in the Modified Total Vaccinated Cohort (mTVc)
outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
outcome.population: The analysis was based on the modified total vaccinated cohort, which included subjects from the total vaccinated cohort, except those who were not administered with the second vaccination or who developed a confirmed case of Herpes Zoster prior to 1 month after the second vaccination.

group.title: GSK1437173A 50-59 YOA Group
group.description: Subjects aged between 50 and 59 years of age (YOA), receiving the GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: GSK1437173A 60-69 YOA Group
group.description: Subjects aged between 60 and 69 years of age (YOA), receiving the GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: GSK1437173A Over 70 YOA Group
group.description: Subjects aged above 70 years of age (YOA), receiving the GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.description: Subjects aged over 50 years of age (YOA), receiving the GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo 50-59 YOA Group
group.description: Subjects aged between 50 and 59 years of age (YOA), receiving placebo according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.description: Subjects aged between 60 and 69 years of age (YOA), receiving placebo according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo Over 70 YOA Group
group.description: Subjects aged above 70 years of age (YOA), receiving placebo according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo Overall Ages Group
group.description: Subjects aged over 50 years of age (YOA), receiving placebo according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Confirmed Herpes Zoster (HZ) Cases
measure.description: Confirmed HZ cases during the study were assessed in the Modified Total Vaccinated Cohort (mTVc)
measure.population: The analysis was based on the modified total vaccinated cohort, which included subjects from the total vaccinated cohort, except those who were not administered with the second vaccination or who developed a confirmed case of Herpes Zoster prior to 1 month after the second vaccination.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Criteria for the vaccine efficacy (VE) objective of herpes zoster subunit (HZ/su) vaccine against herpes zoster (HZ) vaccine, in the 50-59 YOA age strata : The lower limit (LL) of the two-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) of VE had to be above 10%.

Criteria for the vaccine efficacy (VE) objective of herpes zoster subunit (HZ/su) vaccine against herpes zoster (HZ) vaccine, in the 60-69 YOA age strata : The lower limit (LL) of the two-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) of VE had to be above 10%.

Criteria for the vaccine efficacy (VE) objective of herpes zoster subunit (HZ/su) vaccine against herpes zoster (HZ) vaccine, in the 70-79 YOA age strata : The lower limit (LL) of the two-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) of VE had to be above 10%.

Criteria for the vaccine efficacy (VE) objective of herpes zoster subunit (HZ/su) vaccine against herpes zoster (HZ) vaccine, in the overall age strata : The lower limit (LL) of the two-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) of VE had to be above 10%.

outcome.title: Number of Days With Severe ‘Worst’ HZ-associated Pain.
outcome.description: Severe 'worst' pain was defined as HZ-associated pain rated as 3 or above on the 'worst pain' ZBPI questionnaire. This Outcome Measure was only assessed participants with confirmed HZ. This analysis involved any subject reporting ZBPI clinically significant pain (i.e. pain with a score of 3 or more on a 0-10 point scale) at any time during the study.
outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
outcome.population: The analysis was based on the modified total vaccinated cohort, which included subjects from the total vaccinated cohort, except those who were not administered with the second vaccination or who developed a confirmed case of Herpes Zoster prior to 1 month after the second vaccination.

group.description: Subjects aged between 50 and 59 years of age (YOA), receiving the GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

measure.title: Number of Days With Severe ‘Worst’ HZ-associated Pain.
measure.description: Severe 'worst' pain was defined as HZ-associated pain rated as 3 or above on the 'worst pain' ZBPI questionnaire. This Outcome Measure was only assessed participants with confirmed HZ. This analysis involved any subject reporting ZBPI clinically significant pain (i.e. pain with a score of 3 or more on a 0-10 point scale) at any time during the study.
measure.population: The analysis was based on the modified total vaccinated cohort, which included subjects from the total vaccinated cohort, except those who were not administered with the second vaccination or who developed a confirmed case of Herpes Zoster prior to 1 month after the second vaccination.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With HZ Related Complications, by Complication Type
outcome.description: Complication types included HZ vasculitis, Disseminated Disease, Ophtalmic Disease, Neurologic Disease, Visceral Disease and Stroke. This Outcome Measure was only assessed participants with confirmed HZ.

measure.title: Number of Days of Pain Medication Associated With HZ
measure.description: The analysis was performed in subjects with a confirmed HZ episode
measure.population: The analysis was based on the modified total vaccinated cohort, which included subjects from the total vaccinated cohort, except those who were not administered with the second vaccination or who developed a confirmed case of Herpes Zoster prior to 1 month after the second vaccination.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 100 millimeters (mm) of injection site. Relationship analysis was not performed.
outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the total vaccinated cohort – Diary Card, which was a subset of subjects from the total vaccinated cohort, who completed diary cards with any solicited symptoms during the 7 days (Day 0 to Day 6) post vaccination period.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects received herpes zoster subunit vaccine (gE/AS01B vaccine: GSK1437173A) according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects received saline solution (NaCl solution) as control according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
measure.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 100 millimeters (mm) of injection site. Relationship analysis was not performed.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the total vaccinated cohort – Diary Card, which was a subset of subjects from the total vaccinated cohort, who completed diary cards with any solicited symptoms during the 7 days (Day 0 to Day 6) post vaccination period.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, gastrointestinal symptoms, fever [defined as oral, axillary, rectal or tympanic temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)], headache, myalgia, shivering and sweating. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 symptom = symptom that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: Within the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the TVc – Diary Card, which was a subset of subjects from the TVc, who completed diary cards with any solicited symptoms during the 7 days (Day 0 to Day 6) post vaccination period.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects received herpes zoster subunit vaccine (gE/AS01B vaccine: GSK1437173A) according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects received saline solution (NaCl solution) as control according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms
measure.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, gastrointestinal symptoms, fever [defined as oral, axillary, rectal or tympanic temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)], headache, myalgia, shivering and sweating. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 symptom = symptom that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the TVc – Diary Card, which was a subset of subjects from the TVc, who completed diary cards with any solicited symptoms during the 7 days (Day 0 to Day 6) post vaccination period.

outcome.time_frame: Within the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the total vaccinated cohort – Diary Card, which was a subset of subjects from the total vaccinated cohort, who completed diary cards with any solicited symptoms during the 7 days (Day 0 to Day 6) post vaccination period.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects received herpes zoster subunit vaccine (gE/AS01B vaccine: GSK1437173A) according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo Group

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Symptoms (Solicited and Unsolicited)
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the total vaccinated cohort – Diary Card, which was a subset of subjects from the total vaccinated cohort, who completed diary cards with any solicited symptoms during the 7 days (Day 0 to Day 6) post vaccination period.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any and Related Potential Immune Mediated Diseases (pIMDs)
outcome.description: Occurrence and relationship to vaccination of any potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs) in all subjects
outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
outcome.population: This analysis was based on the the total vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one dose of study vaccine or placebo administered.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects received herpes zoster subunit vaccine (gE/AS01B vaccine: GSK1437173A) according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects received saline solution (NaCl solution) as control according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any and Related Potential Immune Mediated Diseases (pIMDs)
measure.description: Occurrence and relationship to vaccination of any potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs) in all subjects
measure.population: This analysis was based on the the total vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one dose of study vaccine or placebo administered.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With AEs With Any and Related Medically Attended Visit (MAEs)
outcome.description: Occurrence and relationship to vaccination of medically attended visits (defined as hospitalizations, emergency room visits or visits to or from medical personnel), other than routine health care visits in all subjects.
outcome.time_frame: From Month 0 to Month 8 post-vaccination
outcome.population: This analysis was based on the the total vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one dose of study vaccine or placebo administered.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects received herpes zoster subunit vaccine (gE/AS01B vaccine: GSK1437173A) according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects received saline solution (NaCl solution) as control according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With AEs With Any and Related Medically Attended Visit (MAEs)
measure.description: Occurrence and relationship to vaccination of medically attended visits (defined as hospitalizations, emergency room visits or visits to or from medical personnel), other than routine health care visits in all subjects.
measure.population: This analysis was based on the the total vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one dose of study vaccine or placebo administered.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: Occurrence, intensity and relationship to vaccination of unsolicited AEs, according to the Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA) classification in all subjects An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination. Grade 3 AE = an AE which prevented normal, everyday activities. Related = AE assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: Within 30 days (Days 0 - 29) after each vaccination
outcome.population: This analysis was based on the the total vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one dose of study vaccine or placebo administered.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects received herpes zoster subunit vaccine (gE/AS01B vaccine: GSK1437173A) according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects received saline solution (NaCl solution) as control according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: Occurrence, intensity and relationship to vaccination of unsolicited AEs, according to the Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA) classification in all subjects An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination. Grade 3 AE = an AE which prevented normal, everyday activities. Related = AE assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.
measure.population: This analysis was based on the the total vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one dose of study vaccine or placebo administered.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: Occurrence and relationship to vaccination of all SAEs in all subjects. Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.
outcome.time_frame: Within the 30-day (Days 0-29) post-vaccination period, up to Month 14 and up to study end (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)
outcome.population: This analysis was based on the the total vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one dose of study vaccine or placebo administered.

group.description: Subjects received herpes zoster subunit vaccine (gE/AS01B vaccine: GSK1437173A) according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects received saline solution (NaCl solution) as control according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: Occurrence and relationship to vaccination of all SAEs in all subjects. Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.
measure.population: This analysis was based on the the total vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one dose of study vaccine or placebo administered.

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited symptoms: within 7 days post-vaccination Unsolicited AEs: within 30 days post vaccination SAEs: during the entire study period (3 to 5 year period following Day 0)

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects received herpes zoster subunit vaccine (gE/AS01B vaccine: GSK1437173A) according to a 0, 2-month schedule.

group.title: Placebo Group

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Carcinoid tumour of the small bowel
Extranodal marginal zone b-cell lymphoma (malt type)
Malignant neoplasm of unknown primary site
Squamous cell carcinoma of the oral cavity

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
